display_en: Demographic Data: AGE OF RESPONDENT (IN CATEGORIES) (IMD2001_2)
question_en: Age of respondent (in categories listed below).
responses_en: (1) YOUNGEST - 24 YEARS (2) 25-34 YEARS (3) 35-44 YEARS (4) 45-54 YEARS (5) 55-64 YEARS (6) 65 - OLDEST
responses_en_rec: (1) Youngest - 24 years (2) 25-34 years (3) 35-44 years (4) 45-54 years (5) 55-64 years (6) 65 - oldest

display_en: Demographic Data: GENDER (IMD2002)
question_en: Gender of Respondent.
responses_en: (1) MALE (2) FEMALE (3) OTHER
responses_en_rec: (1) Male (2) Female (3) Other

display_en: Demographic Data: EDUCATION (IMD2003)
question_en: Education of Respondent.
responses_en: (0) NONE (NO EDUCATION) / ILLITERATE (1) PRIMARY EDUCATION/LOWER SECONDARY EDUCATION (2) HIGHER SECONDARY EDUCATION (3) POST-SECONDARY (NON-UNIVERSITY) EDUCATION (4) UNIVERSITY EDUCATION
responses_en_rec: (0) None (no education) / illiterate (1) Primary education/lower secondary education (2) Higher secondary education (3) Post-secondary (non-university) Education (4) University education

display_en: Demographic Data: MARITAL STATUS (IMD2004)
question_en: Respondent's marital or civil union status.
responses_en: (1) MARRIED OR LIVING TOGETHER AS MARRIED (2) WIDOWED (3) DIVORCED OR SEPARATED (MARRIED BUT SEPARATED/NOT LIVING WITH LEGAL SPOUSE) (4) SINGLE, NEVER MARRIED (5) [SEE ELECTION STUDY NOTES]
responses_en_rec: (1) Married or living together as married (2) Widowed (3) Divorced or separated (married but separated/not living with legal spouse) (4) Single, never married (5) [see election study notes]

display_en: Demographic Data: RELIGIOUS SERVICES ATTENDANCE (IMD2005_1)
question_en: Religious denomination.
responses_en: (1) NEVER (2) ONCE A YEAR (3) TWO TO ELEVEN TIMES A YEAR (4) ONCE A MONTH (5) TWO OR MORE TIMES A MONTH (6) ONCE A WEEK/MORE THAN ONCE A WEEK
responses_en_rec: (1) Never (2) Once a year (3) Two to eleven times a year (4) Once a month (5) Two or more times a month (6) Once a week/more than once a week

display_en: Demographic Data: RELIGIOSITY (IMD2005_2)
question_en: Religiosity.
responses_en: (1) HAVE NO RELIGIOUS BELIEFS (2) NOT VERY RELIGIOUS (3) SOMEWHAT RELIGIOUS (4) VERY RELIGIOUS
responses_en_rec: (1) Have no religious beliefs (2) Not very religious (3) Somewhat religious (4) Very religious

display_en: Demographic Data: HOUSEHOLD INCOME (IMD2006)
question_en: Household income quintile appropriate to the respondent.
responses_en: (1) LOWEST HOUSEHOLD INCOME QUINTILE (2) SECOND HOUSEHOLD INCOME QUINTILE (3) THIRD HOUSEHOLD INCOME QUINTILE (4) FOURTH HOUSEHOLD INCOME QUINTILE (5) HIGHEST HOUSEHOLD INCOME QUINTILE
responses_en_rec: (1) Lowest household income quintile (2) Second household income quintile (3) Third household income quintile (4) Fourth household income quintile (5) Highest household income quintile

display_en: Demographic Data: RURAL OR URBAN RESIDENCE (IMD2007)
question_en: Rural/Urban Residence.
responses_en: (1) RURAL AREA OR VILLAGE (2) SMALL OR MIDDLE-SIZED TOWN (3) SUBURBS OF LARGE TOWN OR CITY (4) LARGE TOWN OR CITY
responses_en_rec: (1) Rural area or village (2) Small or middle-sized town (3) Suburbs of large town or city (4) Large town or city

display_en: Demographic Data: CURRENT EMPLOYMENT STATUS (IMD2014)
question_en: Current employment status of respondent.
responses_en: (0) EMPLOYED : NO HOURS SPECIFIED (1) EMPLOYED : FULL-TIME (32 OR MORE HOURS WEEKLY) (2) EMPLOYED : PART-TIME (15-32 HOURS WEEKLY) (3) EMPLOYED : LESS THAN 15 HOURS (4) HELPING FAMILY MEMBER (5) UNEMPLOYED (6) STUDENT, IN SCHOOL, IN VOCATIONAL TRAINING (7) RETIRED (8) HOMEMAKER, HOME DUTIES (9) PERMANENTLY DISABLED (10) OTHERS, NOT IN LABOR FORCE (11) ON TEMPORARY JOB LEAVE (MATERNITY LEAVE, SICK LEAVE, ETC.) (12) CIVIL / MILITARY SERVICE
responses_en_rec: (0) Employed : no hours specified (1) Employed : full-time (32 or more hours weekly) (2) Employed : part-time (15-32 hours weekly) (3) Employed : less than 15 hours (4) Helping family member (5) Unemployed (6) Student, in school, in vocational training (7) Retired (8) Homemaker, home duties (9) Permanently disabled (10) Others, not in labor force (11) On temporary job leave (maternity leave, sick leave, etc.) (12) Civil / military service

display_en: Demographic Data: SOCIO ECONOMIC STATUS (IMD2016)
question_en: Respondent's socio-economic status.
responses_en: (1) WHITE COLLAR (2) WORKER (3) FARMER (4) SELF-EMPLOYED (5) OTHER
responses_en_rec: (1) White collar (2) Worker (3) Farmer (4) Self-employed (5) Other

responses_en: (0) R IS NOT A MEMBER OF A UNION (1) R IS MEMBER OF A UNION
responses_en_rec: (0) R is not a member of a union (1) R is member of a union

responses_en_rec: (0) Respondent did not cast a ballot (1) Respondent cast a ballot

question_en: Whether or not the respondent cast a ballot in the first/second round of the Presidential elections.
responses_en: (0) RESPONDENT DID NOT CAST A BALLOT (1) RESPONDENT CAST A BALLOT
responses_en_rec: (0) Respondent did not cast a ballot (1) Respondent cast a ballot

responses_en_rec: (0) Respondent did not cast a ballot (1) Respondent cast a ballot

responses_en: (0) RESPONDENT DID NOT CAST A BALLOT (1) RESPONDENT CAST A BALLOT
responses_en_rec: (0) Respondent did not cast a ballot (1) Respondent cast a ballot

display_en: Survey Data: TURNOUT: TURNOUT SWITCHER BETWEEN CURRENT (IMD3001_TS)
question_en: Whether or not the respondent reports voting in the current and previous election.
responses_en: (0) RESPONDENT ABSTAINED IN BOTH ELECTIONS (1) RESPONDENT ABSTAINED IN CURRENT ELECTION BUT VOTED IN PREVIOUS ELECTION (2) RESPONDENT VOTED IN CURRENT ELECTION BUT ABSTAINED IN PREVIOUS ELECTION (3) RESPONDENT VOTED IN BOTH CURRENT AND PREVIOUS ELECTION (5) RESPONDENT ABSTAINED IN CURRENT ELECTION BUT INELIGIBLE TO VOTE IN PREVIOUS ELECTION (6) RESPONDENT VOTED IN CURRENT ELECTION BUT INELIGIBLE TO VOTE IN PREVIOUS ELECTION
responses_en_rec: (0) Respondent abstained in both elections (1) Respondent abstained in current election but voted in previous election (2) Respondent voted in current election but abstained in previous election (3) Respondent voted in both current and previous election (5) Respondent abstained in current election but ineligible to vote in previous election (6) Respondent voted in current election but ineligible to vote in previous election

question_short_en: Vote choice: current main election - vote for outgoing government (incumbent)
display_en: Survey Data: VOTE CHOICE: CURRENT MAIN ELECTION - VOTE FOR OUTGOING GOVERNMENT (INCUMBENT) (IMD3002_OUTGOV)
question_en: Whether or not the respondent cast a ballot for the outgoing incumbent.
responses_en: (0) DID NOT VOTE FOR THE OUTGOING GOVERNMENT (INCUMBENT) (1) VOTED FOR THE OUTGOING GOVERNMENT (INCUMBENT)
responses_en_rec: (0) Did not vote for the outgoing government (incumbent) (1) Voted for the outgoing government (incumbent)

question_short_en: Vote choice: vote switcher between current election and previous election
display_en: Survey Data: VOTE CHOICE: VOTE SWITCHER BETWEEN CURRENT ELECTION AND PREVIOUS ELECTION (IMD3002_VS_1)
question_en: Whether or not the respondent reports voting for the same party/coalition in the current and previous main election.
responses_en: (0) DID NOT SWITCH (VOTED FOR SAME PARTY/COALITION IN CURRENT & PREVIOUS ELECTION) (1) SWITCHER (CHANGED VOTE IN CURRENT ELECTION FROM PREVIOUS ELECTION)
responses_en_rec: (0) Did not switch (voted for same party/coalition in current & previous election) (1) Switcher (changed vote in current election from previous election)

question_short_en: Vote choice: current main election - vote for leftist/center/rightist - cses
display_en: Survey Data: VOTE CHOICE: CURRENT MAIN ELECTION - VOTE FOR LEFTIST/CENTER/RIGHTIST - CSES (IMD3002_LR_CSES)
question_en: Whether or not the respondent reports voting for a leftist/center/rightist party/candidate of the party, based on CSES Collaborators experts' judgment of parties' ideology.
responses_en: (1) VOTED FOR LEFTIST PARTY/CANDIDATE (2) VOTED FOR CENTER PARTY/CANDIDATE (3) VOTED FOR RIGHTIST PARTY/CANDIDATE
responses_en_rec: (1) Voted for leftist party/candidate (2) Voted for center party/candidate (3) Voted for rightist party/candidate

question_short_en: Party identification: are you close to any political party
display_en: Survey Data: PARTY IDENTIFICATION: ARE YOU CLOSE TO ANY POLITICAL PARTY (IMD3005_1)
question_en: Do you usually think of yourself as close to any particular party?
responses_en: (0) NO (1) YES
responses_en_rec: (0) No (1) Yes

display_en: Survey Data: IDEOLOGY: LEFT-RIGHT -  SELF (IMD3006)
question_en: Respondents' self-placement on a 0-10 left-right scale.
responses_en: (0) LEFT (10) RIGHT
responses_en_rec: (0) Left (10) Right

display_en: Survey Data: SATISFACTION WITH DEMOCRACY (IMD3010)
question_en: On the whole, are you very satisfied, fairly satisfied, not very satisfied, or not at all satisfied with the way democracy works in [COUNTRY]?
responses_en: (1) VERY SATISFIED (2) FAIRLY SATISFIED (3) NEITHER SATISFIED NOR DISSATISFIED (4) NOT VERY SATISFIED (5) NOT AT ALL SATISFIED
responses_en_rec: (1) Very satisfied (2) Fairly satisfied (3) Neither satisfied nor dissatisfied (4) Not very satisfied (5) Not at all satisfied

question_short_en: Efficacy: who is in power can make a difference
display_en: Survey Data: EFFICACY: WHO IS IN POWER CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE (IMD3011)
question_en: Some people say that it doesn't make any difference who is in power. Others say that it makes a big difference who is in power. Using the scale on this card, (where ONE means that it doesn't make any difference who is in power and FIVE means that it makes a big difference who is in power), where would you place yourself?
responses_en: (1) IT DOESN'T MAKE ANY DIFFERENCE WHO IS IN POWER (5) IT MAKES A BIG DIFFERENCE WHO IS IN POWER
responses_en_rec: (1) It doesn't make any difference who is in power (5) It makes a big difference who is in power

question_short_en: Efficacy: who people vote for makes a difference
display_en: Survey Data: EFFICACY: WHO PEOPLE VOTE FOR MAKES A DIFFERENCE (IMD3012)
question_en: Some people say that no matter who people vote for, it won't make any difference to what happens. Others say that who people vote for can make a big difference to what happens. Using the scale on this card, (where ONE means that voting won't make any difference to what happens and FIVE means that voting can make a big difference), where would you place yourself?
responses_en: (1) WHO PEOPLE VOTE FOR WON'T MAKE ANY DIFFERENCE (5) WHO PEOPLE VOTE FOR CAN MAKE A BIG DIFFERENCE
responses_en_rec: (1) Who people vote for won't make any difference (5) Who people vote for can make a big difference

display_en: Survey Data: STATE OF ECONOMY (OVER PAST 12 MONTHS) (IMD3013_1)
question_en: Would you say that over the past twelve months, the state of the economy in [COUNTRY] has gotten better, stayed about the same, or gotten worse?
responses_en: (1) GOTTEN BETTER (3) STAYED THE SAME (5) GOTTEN WORSE
responses_en_rec: (1) Gotten better (3) Stayed the same (5) Gotten worse

display_en: Survey Data: STATE OF ECONOMY - BETTER (IMD3013_2)
question_en: Would you say much better or somewhat better?
responses_en: (1) MUCH BETTER (2) SOMEWHAT BETTER
responses_en_rec: (1) Much better (2) Somewhat better

display_en: Survey Data: STATE OF ECONOMY - WORSE (IMD3013_3)
question_en: Would you say much worse or somewhat worse?
responses_en: (4) SOMEWHAT WORSE (5) MUCH WORSE
responses_en_rec: (4) Somewhat worse (5) Much worse

display_en: Survey Data: GOVERNMENT PERFORMANCE: GENERAL (IMD3014)
question_en: Now thinking about the performance of the [government in [CAPITAL]/President] in general, how good or bad a job do you think the [government/President in [CAPITAL]] has done over the past [NUMBER OF YEARS SINCE LAST GOVERNMENT TOOK OFFICE, BEFORE THE CURRENT ELECTION] years? Has [it/he/she] done a very good job? A good job? A bad job? A very bad job?
responses_en: (1) VERY GOOD JOB (2) GOOD JOB (3) BAD JOB (4) VERY BAD JOB
responses_en_rec: (1) Very good job (2) Good job (3) Bad job (4) Very bad job

responses_en: (0 to 100). PERCENT OF REGISTERED VOTERS (ER) WHO VOTED
responses_en_rec: (0 to 100). Percent of registered voters (er) Who voted

responses_en: (0 to 100). PERCENT OF VOTING AGE POPULATION (VAP) WHO VOTED
responses_en_rec: (0 to 100). Percent of voting age population (vap) Who voted

responses_en_rec: (1) Yes; strictly enforced sanctions (2) Yes; weakly enforced sanctions (3) Yes; without sanction for violation (5) No

responses_en_rec: (1) Majoritarian (2) Proportional (3) Mixed

question_en: The electoral formula used to elect the President that is elected by popular vote.

responses_en_rec: (1) Plurality (2) Absolute majority rule (3) Qualified majority rule (4) Electoral college (5) Alternative vote
